c74object.name: randfloats
c74object.description: randfloats is an object for generating high quality random numbers (either 0-1 or 0-n) using either flat or windowed gaussian distributions. Three gaussian functions may also be used simultaneously to create a more complex distribution, with weighting values used to randomly determine which is used.

method.name: bang
method.description:
In the first inlet: A bang will cause an output of a linearly distributed float between 0. and 1.
In the second inlet: A bang cause a float output between 0. and 1. of a windowed gaussian distribution. The parameters for the distribution can be set by sending the mean and deviation as a single message in the left-inlet.
In the third inlet: A bang will cause a float output between 0. and 1. of a triple windowed gaussian distribution. The parameters for the distribution can be set by sending three sets of:
mean / deviation / weight
as a single message in the left-inlet.

method.name: list
method.description:
A message to the left-inlet formatted as:
mean / deviation
will set the parameters for the windowed gaussian distribution for when a bang is sent the the second-inlet.
A message to the left-inlet formatted as three sets of:
mean / deviation / weight
will set the parameters for the triple windowed gaussian distribution for when a bang is sent the the third-inlet.

method.name: int
method.digest: Set a multiplier for the output
method.description: Sending an int (n) into any inlet of randfloats will cause its ouput to be multiplied by that value, changing the output range into 0 to n.

entry.name: float
entry.description: Outputs a high quality random float in the range of either 0. to 1. or 0 to n.
